topic.title: Always-On (AON) Watchdog Timer

body.p: The AON watchdog timer runs directly off the battery and counts 32.768 kHz clock periods when the HB20 CPU cores are booted. The watchdog has two modes of operation. In the default mode of operation, the watchdog creates an interrupt when the timer reaches the default limit. Alternatively, the watchdog issues a full system reset if an AON register bit is set to 1 (default is 0).
